extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for the work surface
metaInformation: plus more for the work surface

extendedIngredients.name: ground ginger
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger, or more to taste (up to 3 teaspoons is safe if you like a truly gingery gingerbread)
metaInformation: (up to 3 teaspoons is safe if you like a truly gingery gingerbread)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
icing
extendedIngredients.originalString: Royal icing, melted chocolate, nuts, candied ginger, and dried fruit

extendedIngredients.name: sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons sugar (granulated or light brown sugar)

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 tablespoons unsalted butter, chilled and cubed

recipes.title: Gingerbread Men Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco are great choices for Gingerbread Men. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: 1. To make the gingerbread people cookies, heat the oven to 325°F (163°C).2. Place the flour, baking powder, ginger, butter, sugar, and honey in a food processor and pulse until you get crumbs. Add the water and mix until a ball of dough forms.3. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and roll out with a rolling pin until about ¼ inch thick. Cut out people with cutters dipped in flour and place them on the baking sheet.4. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes if using large cookie cutters, less time if using small cutters. Let the gingerbread people cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet prior to transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.5. To decorate, pipe icing or melted chocolate onto the gingerbread people as clothes, using a pastry bag or a resealable plastic bag with one corner snipped off. You can also accessorize the gingerbread people with chopped nuts, candied ginger, dried fruit, whatever you please. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

steps.step: To make the gingerbread people cookies, heat the oven to 325°F (163°C).2.
Place the flour, baking powder, ginger, butter, sugar, and honey in a food processor and pulse until you get crumbs.
Add the water and mix until a ball of dough forms.3.
Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and roll out with a rolling pin until about ¼ inch thick.
Cut out people with cutters dipped in flour and place them on the baking sheet.4.
Bake for 20 to 30 minutes if using large cookie cutters, less time if using small cutters.

Let the gingerbread people cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet prior to transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.5. To decorate, pipe icing or melted chocolate onto the gingerbread people as clothes, using a pastry bag or a resealable plastic bag with one corner snipped off. You can also accessorize the gingerbread people with chopped nuts, candied ginger, dried fruit, whatever you please. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
